messages.message: CC: @hannah managing the lifecycle points of a user
Thanks for calling this out! cc: @Liam Callanan
We have different modals for users vs. admins, so a user shouldn't be able to navigate to this page

Just to be clear, shouldn’t only admins have access to `/usage` @hannah?
I think the issue here is that clicking this nav item always links to `/usage` but after expiration it should instead show the expiration modal
Yes @Liam Callanan! sorry meant to say "shouldn't be able to navigate to this page". Updated message above. I agree we should throw up an expiration modal rather than allowing them to click here.

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/56984
Expiration modals already auto-appear so I’ve disabled the link for non-admins.
For admins the item will link to the new billing/subscription page.
